text: Well I mean it is hard to not talk about the absolute storm and hurricane this mobile game caused back in the summer. For reference, this app was single handily responsible for Nintendo's stock, at one point, to be worth more than Sony's Stock as a collective whole for about a week. Now that's saying something and the impact this game had!

author: Eric C.

text: If there's one game that provided me with the most memorable moments in 2016, Pokemon GO would be it. Strictly as a video game, this is of course extremely average in terms of gameplay, but what it made me do outside of the game was amazing. I rediscovered my city in places I hadn't been in a while, I discovered new places I had never been to and I interacted with tons of great people while walking kilometers and kilometers. Really, the first month or two after this game's launch was nothing short of magical. It reminded me of the feeling I get when playing a newly launched MMO with everyone, but in real life. It just felt good to see so many people simply happy to be catching that Pikachu or hatching that 10km egg. It's too bad Niantic took way too long to provide essential updates, but I do see some reinvigorated interest with the recent Gen 2 update. Of course the cold winter time here in Canada doesn't help, I myself having mostly stopped playing because of that. Still, even if I never really play this game seriously again, I'm just glad to have been there and for these great moments. Oh and gotta love this theme's synth bass!
author: SupraDarky

text: first month after release was insane

author: Jordan Oliver

author: cwopre

text: Summer of 2016 was one of the best ever, the amount of new friends I've gained because of this game is incredible. Especially since in the cold white north where I'm from, it's considered "unusual" to interact with stangers if not absolutely necessary. Well, that mindset went straight out of the window because of PoGo. We've had meetings in here that thousands of people participated in, I've been sitting on lures with total strangers (their ages varying between 12 and 70 or so) in the middle of a nightless nights, and it also brought me even closer to my girlfriend whom I shared all it all with. I also have nearly 2500km of walking in my meter since then, my poor knees don't like it but my general fitness does. As a game it's not great, but it does have an eternal place in my heart nevertheless.
author: Ode For Cruelty

text: same here. It was a great start and I loved the interaction with people. I still fire it up on a daily basis as I walk the dog or travel to a new place. Like my GF and me went to Japan last year and of course we caught Pokemon over there as well. Best meta game of the year ;)
